name: Radish Salad
description: Radish salad is something you see in places around the world (in the last couple of years, I have been served it in similar guises in both Mexico and Turkey), but almost never in this country. Salting the radishes first reduces their harshness while accenting their crispness. At that point, they can be dressed with a traditional vinaigrette or the more tropical (and oil-less) version here. The only trick is to slice the radishes thinly. For this, a mandoline is best.
keywords: chili pepper, radish, dairy-free, gluten-free, low calorie, low cholesterol, low-fat, nut-free, vegan, vegetarian, fall, spring, summer, side dish
recipeIngredient: Ground Urfa or other mild chilies to taste (optional)

recipeInstructions.text: Combine radishes with salt, and cover with water in a bowl. Let sit 15 minutes. Drain, and rinse. Meanwhile, stir together the pepper and fruit juices.
Toss radishes with dressing and chilies. Taste. Add more salt, pepper or lime juice as needed. Garnish with herb, and serve.
